definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: When at last the party was over, Hjalmar drove home in the thimble and went to bed again.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮結束後，哈吉馬又鑽進頂針裏，回家睡覺了。

sentences.english: Apparently—for the sake of convenience—Haji, the manservant, had also adopted his master's diet.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，他的男僕哈吉，爲了方便，也隨主人喫素了。

sentences.english: So Hjalmar thanked her politely and climbed in the thimble.
sentences.chinese: 哈吉馬禮貌地謝過她，爬進了頂針。

sentences.english: He came and sat on Hjalmar's bed to tell him a story while he was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 他進門後就坐在牀邊給睡着的哈吉馬將起了故事。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Hartge remains optimistic about the future.
sentences.chinese: 然而，哈吉對未來表示很樂觀。

sentences.english: We were trying to rouse her when Haji walked in from the garden entrance.
sentences.chinese: 當哈吉從花園的門進來的時候，我們正試圖喚醒她。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Aba, southeast Nigerian city/Aba, the Lisu 傈僳 word for grandfather
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Ur (Sumerian city c. 4500 BC in modern Iraq)
